intro: Gomphandra hainanensis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved gomphandra, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island, China. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native region.
